body:
> purge doesn't work as is for folders created within swift. ls command doesn't work either. I have to run the command mkdir on the subdirectory before it can be purged.

How did you originally create the folders.  Can you give an example so I can reproduce the problem?

> 2015/10/13 03:49:54 Attempt 1/3 failed with 2 errors and: Container Not Empty
> 2015/10/13 03:49:54 Waiting for deletions to finish

Yes, I think that is a bug.  It shouldn't be attempting to delete the container if you are using a sub-directory.  The same bug is probably in `s3` and `google cloud storage`!

> EDIT: Those issues seem to be related to the way my Swift provider is managing directories. I get a third issue when using ./rclone sync swift:container/sub local. Directories in sub are created as 0-byte-files (and I get errors for all files in those directories).

That is the old style way of creating pseudo directories in swift.  I thought rclone ignored them, but checking the code apparently it doesn't, so that is probably a bug.

How did you create those directories? Using the swift tool?

Who is your provider? And which version of Swift or Openstack are you using?

Thanks

Nick

My provider is Hubic (from OVH) and I'm creating folders from their client. I searched their docs and forum to know how their client is creating folder but didn't find any information about it. I'll try to get more informations from my swift server itself. Currently, Linux swift client refuse to authenticate with my gateway which only support auth v1.0. Do you have any docs about the way folders are created in swift ?

Directory Markers are zero-length objects which have the metadata content-type set to "application/directory".

It sounds like that is what the client is creating and rclone isn't ignoring them like it should.

Most clients don't bother creating them though as swift now deals quite well with so called pseudo directories.

You're right. I was able to check with Python client and I get those headers : `'content-length': '0'` and `'content-type': 'application/directory'`. Python client is not supporting them neither. I'll try to fix that too.
@axtux thanks for confirming that - I'll think about how to fix properly.  It will require an implementation of `Purger` for swift if we filter the 0 length files out...

The more I play with it, the more I understand how it works. Swift Python client is only checking that `content-type` equals `text/directory` see https://github.com/openstack/python-swiftclient/blob/master/swiftclient/service.py#L1130 not sure why as my directories have `content-type` set to `application/directory` but it could be useful to check both. I think size could be checked too but at least `content-type` as 0-length files could exist.

IMO, what should be changed :
- purge : don't try to delete container if purging subdirectory
- purge : rclone should delete those directories (not sure why there is an error here)
- sync : ignoring them (in both directions)

Maybe I'll try to make these changes on my own but I don't know how go works and I'm quite busy for now.

issue.title: Errors copying local to swift

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello, I correctly configured swift. The name of remote service is hubic
When i launch the following command:
rclone copy "C:/myfolder" "hubic:default/myfolder"
I receive error: can't copy file due to limited fs

Why can't i copy a local path to a hubic folder?

issue.title: Error copying swift to Amazon Cloud Drive

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello, correctly configured swift and acd. remotes name are : hubic and amazon
if i launche the following command:
rclone copy "hubic:mycontainer" "amazon:myfolder"

it shows me errors and for examples hubic's folders are being created as files on amazon side.

Bugs?
On my testing rclone is bugged like hell!

body: yes. It seems to be the same problem. Do you have any eta for the fix or workaround? Thank you
@xgiovio I'll try to do it this week - cross fingers!
